data.title: Mephisto possibly joining the MCU
data.meta_description:
Rumors are that Sacha Baron Cohen will play Mephisto in the MCU. He might be popping up in Iron Heart. 

Sacha Baron Cohen Rumored To Be Playing MEPHISTO In...
data.meta_site_name: RPF Costume and Prop Maker Community
data.text:
Is there a specific Mephisto storyline that made people just NEED this guy in their flicks?

I know of him, but like a "Harley Quinn" I've never really cared for the character... But when I see a vocal fandom behind a name, I like to check out the "Best of"... see if I can be won over.

Any recommendations?

He's a big part of Ghost Rider's story and GR is one of my favorite heroes, so I guess thats why I'm a little bias.

If you want to dive into the character a bit there is Mephisto: Speak of The Devil trade. Spider-Man One More Day is a really great 4-part is so so good.

Part of me thinks that putting the literal devil in a marvel movie is going to be tricky, but between werewolves and aliens and interdimensional demons I'm sure they can manage it.

He's a big part of Ghost Rider's story and GR is one of my favorite heroes, so I guess thats why I'm a little bias.

If you want to dive into the character a bit there is Mephisto: Speak of The Devil trade. Spider-Man One More Day is a really great 4-part is so so good.

That's handy... already had "One more day" on the list....

If Sacha is doing this, then it has to be a comedy slant. Unless this is one of

those , " I want to do something more dramatic and get away from comedy", deals. He might be a good dramatic actor underneath. But I don't know how to get this out of my mind.

People have been speculating about this for ages. They thought Dr. Strange in No Way Home would be Mephisto. They thought he'd show up in Dr. Strange 2. They thought he'd be in Wandavision (and yet, it was Agatha all along). And still, no Mephisto.

I wouldn't be surprised if they add him at some point, but I'd rather have it be confirmed than rumored before I devote much mental energy to it.

Deadline is even picking up on this, so looks like its all but confirmed.

The Dish: Is Sacha Baron Cohen Joining MCU?

Speculation is growing that Sacha Baron Cohen has entered the Marvel Cinematic Universe with a role in Marvel Studios’ upcoming Disney+ series Ironheart as a comic book villain. A source clos…

If Sacha is doing this, then it has to be a comedy slant. Unless this is one of

those , " I want to do something more dramatic and get away from comedy", deals. He might be a good dramatic actor underneath. But I don't know how to get this out of my mind.

He did a miniseries "The Spy" and "The Trial of the Chicago 7" if you want to see his recent dramatic work. They earned him an academy and golden globe nominations.

Thanks I'll ck them out.
